trans-unit.source: Enable this option only if your server allows URL rewriting (recommended).
trans-unit.target: Enable this option only if your server allows URL rewriting (recommended).

trans-unit.source: URL rewriting (mod_rewrite) is not active on your server, or it is not possible to check your server configuration. If you want to use Friendly URLs, you must activate this mod.
trans-unit.target: URL rewriting (mod_rewrite) is not active on your server, or it is not possible to check your server configuration. If you want to use Friendly URLs, you must activate this mod.

trans-unit.source: Enable this option if you want to allow accented characters in your friendly URLs.
trans-unit.target: Enable this option if you want to allow accented characters in your friendly URLs.

trans-unit.source: You should only activate this option if you are using non-latin characters ; for all the latin charsets, your SEO will be better without this option.
trans-unit.target: You should only activate this option if you are using non-latin characters ; for all the latin charsets, your SEO will be better without this option.

trans-unit.source: Enable this option only if you have problems with URL rewriting.
trans-unit.target: Enable this option only if you have problems with URL rewriting.

trans-unit.source: Some of PrestaShop's features might not work correctly with a specific configuration of Apache's mod_security module. We recommend to turn it off.
trans-unit.target: Some of PrestaShop's features might not work correctly with a specific configuration of Apache's mod_security module. We recommend to turn it off.

trans-unit.source: You can search for a new domain name or add a domain name that you already own. You will be redirected to your PrestaShop account.
trans-unit.target: You can search for a new domain name or add a domain name that you already own. You will be redirected to your PrestaShop account.

trans-unit.source: Set to 0 to disable this feature.

trans-unit.target: Number of products displayed per page. Default is 10.

trans-unit.target: The order in which products are displayed in the product list.

trans-unit.source: Set to "0" to disable this feature.
trans-unit.target: Set to "0" to disable this feature.

trans-unit.target: Display or hide the "add to cart" button on category pages for products that have attributes forcing customers to see product details.

trans-unit.source: In the volume discounts board, display the new price with the applied discount instead of showing the discount (ie. "-5%").

trans-unit.source: By default, the Add to Cart button is hidden when a product is unavailable. You can choose to have it displayed in all cases.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Add to Cart button is hidden when a product is unavailable. You can choose to have it displayed in all cases.

trans-unit.source: After a customer logs in, you can recall and display the content of his/her last shopping cart.
trans-unit.target: After a customer logs in, you can recall and display the content of his/her last shopping cart.

trans-unit.source: Send an email with summary of the account information (email, password) after registration.
trans-unit.target: Send an email with summary of the account information (email, password) after registration.

trans-unit.source: Minimum time required between two requests for a password reset.
trans-unit.target: Minimum time required between two requests for a password reset.

trans-unit.source: Activate or deactivate B2B mode. When this option is enabled, B2B features will be made available.
trans-unit.target: Activate or deactivate B2B mode. When this option is enabled, B2B features will be made available.

trans-unit.source: Leave blank if no change.
trans-unit.target: Leave blank if no change.

trans-unit.source: Fee given for each visit.
trans-unit.target: Fee given for each visit.

trans-unit.source: Fee given for each order placed.
trans-unit.target: Fee given for each order placed.

trans-unit.source: If you own an SSL certificate for your shop's domain name, you can activate SSL encryption (https://) for customer account identification and order processing.
trans-unit.target: If you own an SSL certificate for your shop's domain name, you can activate SSL encryption (https://) for customer account identification and order processing.

trans-unit.source: If you want to enable SSL on all the pages of your shop, activate the "Enable on all the pages" option below.
trans-unit.target: If you want to enable SSL on all the pages of your shop, activate the "Enable on all the pages" option below.

trans-unit.source: When enabled, all the pages of your shop will be SSL-secured.
trans-unit.target: When enabled, all the pages of your shop will be SSL-secured.

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable token in the Front Office to improve PrestaShop's security.
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable token in the Front Office to improve PrestaShop's security.

trans-unit.source: Allow iframes on text fields like product description. We recommend that you leave this option disabled.
trans-unit.target: Allow iframes on text fields like product description. We recommend that you leave this option disabled.

trans-unit.source: Clean the HTML content on text fields. We recommend that you leave this option enabled.
trans-unit.target: Clean the HTML content on text fields. We recommend that you leave this option enabled.

trans-unit.source: You can choose among 6 different ways of rounding prices. "Round up away from zero ..." is the recommended behavior.
trans-unit.target: You can choose among 6 different ways of rounding prices. "Round up away from zero ..." is the recommended behavior.

trans-unit.source: You can choose when to round prices: either on each item, each line or the total (of an invoice, for example).
trans-unit.target: You can choose when to round prices: either on each item, each line or the total (of an invoice, for example).

trans-unit.source: Choose how many decimals you want to display
trans-unit.target: Choose how many decimals you want to display

trans-unit.source: Enable best sellers page on your front office even when its respective module is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Enable best sellers page on your front office even when its respective module is disabled.

trans-unit.source: The multistore feature allows you to manage several e-shops with one Back Office. If this feature is enabled, a "Multistore" page will be available in the "Advanced Parameters" menu.
trans-unit.target: The multistore feature allows you to manage several e-shops with one Back Office. If this feature is enabled, a "Multistore" page will be available in the "Advanced Parameters" menu.

trans-unit.source: Contact name (e.g. Customer Support).
trans-unit.target: Contact name (e.g. Customer Support).

trans-unit.source: Emails will be sent to this address.
trans-unit.target: Emails will be sent to this address.

trans-unit.source: If enabled, all messages will be saved in the "Customer Service" page under the "Customer" menu.
trans-unit.target: If enabled, all messages will be saved in the "Customer Service" page under the "Customer" menu.

trans-unit.source: Further information regarding this contact.
trans-unit.target: Further information regarding this contact.

trans-unit.source: Enable the automatic indexing of products. If you enable this feature, the products will be indexed in the search automatically when they are saved. If the feature is disabled, you will have to index products manually by using the links provided in the field set.
trans-unit.target: Enable the automatic indexing of products. If you enable this feature, the products will be indexed in the search automatically when they are saved. If the feature is disabled, you will have to index products manually by using the links provided in the field set.

trans-unit.source: By default, to search for “blouse”, you have to enter “blous”, “blo”, etc (beginning of the word) – but not “lous” (within the word).
trans-unit.target: By default, to search for “blouse”, you have to enter “blous”, “blo”, etc (beginning of the word) – but not “lous” (within the word).

trans-unit.source: With this option enabled, it also gives the good result if you search for “lous”, “ouse”, or anything contained in the word.
trans-unit.target: With this option enabled, it also gives the good result if you search for “lous”, “ouse”, or anything contained in the word.

trans-unit.source: Enable search within a whole word, rather than from its beginning only.
trans-unit.target: Enable search within a whole word, rather than from its beginning only.

trans-unit.source: It checks if the searched term is contained in the indexed word. This may be resource-consuming.
trans-unit.target: It checks if the searched term is contained in the indexed word. This may be resource-consuming.

trans-unit.source: By default, if you search "book", you will have "book", "bookcase" and "bookend".
trans-unit.target: By default, if you search "book", you will have "book", "bookcase" and "bookend".

trans-unit.source: With this option enabled, it only gives one result “book”, as exact end of the indexed word is matching.
trans-unit.target: With this option enabled, it only gives one result “book”, as exact end of the indexed word is matching.

trans-unit.source: Enable more precise search with the end of the word.
trans-unit.target: Enable more precise search with the end of the word.

trans-unit.source: It checks if the searched term is the exact end of the indexed word.
trans-unit.target: It checks if the searched term is the exact end of the indexed word.

trans-unit.source: Only words this size or larger will be indexed.
trans-unit.target: Only words this size or larger will be indexed.

trans-unit.source: Please enter the index words separated by a "|".
trans-unit.target: Please enter the index words separated by a "|".

trans-unit.source: Enter each alias separated by a comma (e.g. 'prestshop,preztashop,prestasohp').
trans-unit.target: Enter each alias separated by a comma (e.g. 'prestshop,preztashop,prestasohp').

trans-unit.source: Search this word instead.
trans-unit.target: Search this word instead.

trans-unit.source: This field does not refer to the shop name visible in the front office.
trans-unit.target: This field does not refer to the shop name visible in the front office.

trans-unit.source: Follow %sthis link%s to edit the shop name used on the front office.
trans-unit.target: Follow %sthis link%s to edit the shop name used on the front office.

trans-unit.source: You can't edit the shop group because the current shop belongs to a group with the "share" option enabled.
trans-unit.target: You can't edit the shop group because the current shop belongs to a group with the "share" option enabled.

trans-unit.source: This is the root category of the store that you've created. To define a new root category for your store, %splease click here%s.
trans-unit.target: This is the root category of the store that you've created. To define a new root category for your store, %splease click here%s.

trans-unit.source: By selecting associated categories, you are choosing to share the categories between shops. Once associated between shops, any alteration of this category will impact every shop.
trans-unit.target: By selecting associated categories, you are choosing to share the categories between shops. Once associated between shops, any alteration of this category will impact every shop.

trans-unit.source: Show me more
trans-unit.target: Show me more

trans-unit.source: The "http_referer" field is the website from which your customers arrive.
trans-unit.target: The "http_referer" field is the website from which your customers arrive.

trans-unit.source: For example, visitors coming from Google will have an "http_referer" value like this one: "http://www.google.com/search?q=prestashop".
trans-unit.target: For example, visitors coming from Google will have an "http_referer" value like this one: "http://www.google.com/search?q=prestashop".

trans-unit.source: If the visitor arrives directly (by typing the URL of your shop, or by using their bookmarks, for example), the http_referer will be empty.
trans-unit.target: If the visitor arrives directly (by typing the URL of your shop, or by using their bookmarks, for example), the http_referer will be empty.

trans-unit.source: If you'd like to view all the visitors coming from Google, you can type "%google%" in this field. Alternatively, you can type "%google.fr%" if you want to view visitors coming from Google France, only.
trans-unit.target: If you'd like to view all the visitors coming from Google, you can type "%google%" in this field. Alternatively, you can type "%google.fr%" if you want to view visitors coming from Google France, only.

trans-unit.source: The "request_uri" field is the URL from which the customers come to your website.
trans-unit.target: The "request_uri" field is the URL from which the customers come to your website.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the visitor accesses a product page, the URL will be like this one: "%smusic-ipods/1-ipod-nano.html".
trans-unit.target: For example, if the visitor accesses a product page, the URL will be like this one: "%smusic-ipods/1-ipod-nano.html".

trans-unit.source: This is helpful because you can add tags or tokens in the links pointing to your website.
trans-unit.target: This is helpful because you can add tags or tokens in the links pointing to your website.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can post a link (such as "%sindex.php?myuniquekeyword" -- note that you added "?myuniquekeyword" at the end of the URL) in an online forum or as a blog comment, and get visitors statistics for that unique link by entering "%%myuniquekeyword" in the "request_uri" field.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can post a link (such as "%sindex.php?myuniquekeyword" -- note that you added "?myuniquekeyword" at the end of the URL) in an online forum or as a blog comment, and get visitors statistics for that unique link by entering "%%myuniquekeyword" in the "request_uri" field.

trans-unit.source: This method is more reliable than the "http_referer" one, but there is one disadvantage: if a search engine references a page with your link, then it will be displayed in the search results and you will not only indicate visitors from the places where you posted the link, but also those from the search engines that picked up that link.
trans-unit.target: This method is more reliable than the "http_referer" one, but there is one disadvantage: if a search engine references a page with your link, then it will be displayed in the search results and you will not only indicate visitors from the places where you posted the link, but also those from the search engines that picked up that link.

trans-unit.source: The "Include" fields indicate what has to be included in the URL.
trans-unit.target: The "Include" fields indicate what has to be included in the URL.

trans-unit.source: The "Exclude" fields indicate what has to be excluded from the URL.
trans-unit.target: The "Exclude" fields indicate what has to be excluded from the URL.

trans-unit.source: The Simple mode uses the MySQL "LIKE" pattern matching, but for a higher potency you can use MySQL's regular expressions in the Expert mode.
trans-unit.target: The Simple mode uses the MySQL "LIKE" pattern matching, but for a higher potency you can use MySQL's regular expressions in the Expert mode.

trans-unit.source: Take a look at MySQL's documentation for more details.
trans-unit.target: Take a look at MySQL's documentation for more details.

trans-unit.source: Get help!
trans-unit.target: Get help!

trans-unit.source: There is a huge quantity of data, so each connection corresponding to a referrer is indexed. You can also refresh this index by clicking the "Refresh index" button. This process may take a while, and it's only needed if you modified or added a referrer, or if you want changes to be retroactive.
trans-unit.target: There is a huge quantity of data, so each connection corresponding to a referrer is indexed. You can also refresh this index by clicking the "Refresh index" button. This process may take a while, and it's only needed if you modified or added a referrer, or if you want changes to be retroactive.

trans-unit.source: Your data is cached in order to sort it and filter it. You can refresh the cache by clicking on the "Refresh cache" button.
trans-unit.target: Your data is cached in order to sort it and filter it. You can refresh the cache by clicking on the "Refresh cache" button.

trans-unit.source: Direct traffic can be quite resource-intensive. You should consider enabling it only if you have a strong need for it.
trans-unit.target: Direct traffic can be quite resource-intensive. You should consider enabling it only if you have a strong need for it.
